title: Shooter's Mother Reportedly Identified As Employee Of Catholic School He Attacked
description: The mother of the suspect identified in a Wednesday mass shooting at a Minneapolis, Minnesota, Catholic school reportedly worked for the institution he targeted.
content:
The mother of the man identified as the suspect in a Wednesday mass shooting at a Minneapolis, Minnesota, Catholic school reportedly worked for the institution he targeted.

Officials say that Robin Westman killed two children, injured numerous others and fatally shot himself at Annunciation Catholic School, where she worked, 11Alive reported, citing law enforcement sources. Two children aged 8 and 10 “were killed where they sat in the pews” during a Mass service and 17 other people were injured before the gunman fatally shot himself, police said in a press conference after the attack. Seventeen others were injured, including fourteen children, police said. (RELATED: Catholic School Shooting Suspect Reportedly Identified, Manifestos Found)

A man dressed in black and carrying was seen at the site of the attack, multiple outlets reported. A now-deleted YouTube channel showing Robin Westman’s name shows a pile of weapons and other items with a seemingly incoherent assortment of anti-Christian messages, racial slurs and other statements written on them, the Daily Caller News Foundation previously reported.

The Minneapolis Police Department did not immediately respond to the DCNF’s request for comment.

summary: The mother of the suspect, Robin Westman, has been identified as working at the Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Two children were killed and 17 others were injured during a Mass service. A now-deceased YouTube page showing Westman's name shows a pile of weapons and other items with anti-Christian messages, racial slurs, and other statements.
shortSummary: The mother of suspected gunman Robin Westman killed two children and injured 17 others at Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis, Minnesota, on Wednesday.

scraped_sources.text:
Authorities have reportedly identified the man who police say opened fire on children at a Catholic school in Minneapolis, Minnesota, on Wednesday before killing himself.
Authorities identified Robin Westman, a man in his early 20s, as the gunman who killed two children while they attended Mass at Annunciation Catholic School, injured 17 other people and fatally shot himself Wednesday morning, local and national news outlets reported, citing law enforcement sources. Videos from a channel bearing Westman’s name were posted on YouTube around the time of the attack, showing disturbing footage featuring multiple guns, cartridges and ammunition with statements written on the weaponry such as “where is your God?” and other ramblings, the Daily Caller News Foundation found. (RELATED: ‘Horrific Shooting’ Reported At Catholic School)
We have confirmation that the shooter at Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis, MN was a 22 year-old man, claiming to be transgender.
This deranged monster targeted our most vulnerable: young children praying in their first morning Mass of the school year. This deeply sick…
— Secretary Kristi Noem (@Sec_Noem) August 27, 2025
The videos, which the DCNF saved before they were deleted, show what appears to be Westman filming an array of weapons in a bedroom and writings on paper apologizing to his family. A thumbnail image from a four-year-old video on the channel shows a man whose face matches images of Westman shared by The New York Post.
“I was corrupted by this world and have learned to hate what life is … I have wanted this for so long. I am not well. I am not right. I am a sad person, haunted by these thoughts that do not go away,” a notebook shown on camera reads.
One message written on weaponry in the video said “Guy Bartkus,” an apparent reference to the man who authorities say blew himself up at a fertility clinic in California in May because he believed humans should not procreate. Another name written on a gun was “Rupnow,” the last name of a high school student who opened fire at a Christian school in Wisconsin in December before killing herself.
Other written messages in the videos show a seemingly incoherent mix of racial slurs, a pride flag, calls to kill President Donald Trump, the phrase “kill pedos,” pentagram symbols, and a statement that “6 million wasn’t enough,” apparently referring to the six million Jews killed in the Holocaust. One of Westman’s guns was inscribed, “There is no message.”
Another clip of the footage shows a picture of Jesus Christ on a shooting target, while the words “fuck everything that you stand for” are seen on one of the cartridges.
Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem confirmed in an X post Wednesday afternoon that the gunman wrote “For the Children,” “Where is your God?” and “Kill Donald Trump” on a cartridge, matching what the deleted videos show.
“We have confirmation that the shooter at Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis, MN was a 22 year-old man, claiming to be transgender,” Noem wrote. FBI Director Kash Patel also posted that Westman changed his name from Robert to Robin.
“The FBI is investigating this shooting as an act of domestic terrorism and hate crime targeting Catholics,” Patel wrote.
The suspected gunman did not have an extensive criminal history, authorities said Wednesday, according to FOX9.
The FBI’s Minneapolis office and the Minneapolis Police Department did not respond to the DCNF’s requests for comment.

An active shooter opened fire at a Catholic school for young children in Minneapolis, Minnesota, on Wednesday, according to officials and news coverage.
The shooting occurred at Annunciation Catholic School, which teaches kindergarteners through eighth-graders, while the students were in a morning Mass service, FOX6 Milwaukee reported, citing neighbors at the scene. Two children aged 8 and 10 “were killed where they sat in the pews” and 17 other people were injured before the gunman fatally shot himself, Minneapolis Police Chief Brian O’Hara said in a press conference. Fourteen of the 17 injured are children, the chief said.
WATCH:
Police also said a man dressed in black with a rifle was reported at the scene, according to KARE11 and FOX9.
The City of Minneapolis posted on X that “the shooter is contained” and that “there is no active threat to the community at this time.”
“Stay away from the area to allow emergency personnel to help victims,” the city wrote.
“I’ve been briefed on a shooting at Annunciation Catholic School and will continue to provide updates as we get more information,” Democratic Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz said in an X post, adding that state law enforcement agencies are on the scene. “I’m praying for our kids and teachers whose first week of school was marred by this horrific act of violence.”
Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem posted on X that her Department of Homeland Security (DHS) “is monitoring the horrific shooting” and communicating with “interagency partners.”
President Donald Trump also posted on Truth Social that the FBI is on the scene and that “the White House will continue to monitor this terrible situation.”

argos_summary: A 22‑year‑old man, identified as Robin Westman, opened fire at Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis during a morning Mass, killing two children aged 8 and 10 and injuring 17 others before taking his own life. Westman, who worked at the school, had posted a deleted YouTube channel containing weapons and hateful messages, and authorities are treating the attack as domestic terrorism and a hate crime. Officials, including the Minneapolis Police Department and the FBI, are investigating the incident while state and federal leaders have issued statements of support and monitoring.
